headline.main: KNOX UPHOLDS PLAN OF TARAWA ACTION; Attack So Costly to Marines in Part Because Wind's Shift Stranded Landing Craft ATOLL'S AIRFIELD IN USE Nimitz, on Flying Visit There, Stresses Its Development as Base for Further Offensive

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 -- Secretary of the Navy Frank Knox asserted today that the Navy was "not fooled" in estimating Japanese strength before the costly attack on Tarawa atoll, but that "a sudden shifting of the wind" had contributed to the high American losses.
abstract: says wind shift increased US losses
